intro: Pseudojumellea coutrixii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, nocturnal flowers. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues and drought-resistant features.
